content: I guess I found the place, and the answer to my dilemma. The code seems to be at mail/common/src/main/java/com/fsck/k9/mail/ssl/TrustManagerFactory.java and the exception is raised only for not default trusted certs. My phone is old and LetsEncrypt root CA seems not there.
creator: tron2

content:
1. "Settings" > "General settings" > "Notifications" > untick "Disable notifications" and untick "Quiet time".

2. (I am not sure whether this step is necessary or not) (Still in "Notifications") "Lock Screen Notifications" > choose the option you like.

3. "Settings" > tap the account you want to configure > "Notifications" > "New mail ringtone" > choose the option you like.

4. (Still in "Notifications") "Notification categories" section > "Messages" > configure notifications here.
creator: Yu5tiqX9og

content: I get this every couple of days on a variety of accounts with gmail.com and comcast.net. Even though I get this message the accounts are able to receive and send emails just fine. I have tried removing the accounts and re-adding them and it makes no difference.
